intro: Uapaca silvestris, commonly known as wild velvet bean, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain edible seeds, which are rich in protein and used in local cuisines. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Uapaca silvestris also has traditional medicinal uses in various African communities.
